result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick L Copus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.
Concurrent with: Count 2

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant is to have No Confrontational contact with C. Riel, as named in the complaint.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick L Copus

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: JOC returned by USPS - Not Deliverable as Addressed - Unable to Forward

11:00 am case called. Defendant Patrick L Copus, via phone in court with attorney Andrew John Sulewski.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant regarding waiver of personal appearance-defendant waives personal appearance and accepts waiver.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to both counts.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: Impose 7 months WCJ, STAYED and places the defendant on probation for 18 months. Concurrent to each other. If revoked, with Huber and Good Time Credit. No Credit for Time Served.  CONDITIONS: No Confrontational contact with C. Riel, as named in the complaint. Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan.  DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given to Attorney Sulewski to be signed and returned within one week.
from Atty Sulewski requesting a telephonic appearance for the defendant at the plea/sentencing hearing - Granted by the Court

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Patrick L Copus in court with attorney Andrew John Sulewski.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Sulewski requesting a plea/sentencing hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 11:00 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Andrew John Sulewski in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by Attorney Sulewski requests additional status to discuss the matter with the DA.  Status conference scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Patrick L Copus
Current: 1300 Lange Court, Baraboo, WI 53913 United States  (Effective: 10-01-2015)
Prior: 445 W Lincoln Ave; Lohrville, Redgranite, WI 54970
Defendant's Authorization to Appear and Act

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Executed Signature Bond form to be returned no later than October 2, 2015.

Case Called @ 1:45 PM: Attorney Andrew John Sulewski in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Authorization presented to the Court.  Def does not appear.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.    NGP received and entered.  DA argues as to bond with conditions.  Atty Sulewski does not object to bond request.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Warrant Withdrawn by the Court.  Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 09:20 am.

Case Called @ 2:40 PM: Defendant Patrick L Copus not in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause determination as to both counts.  Arrest Warrant authorized within the State of Wisconsin.
